cmd.description: See services installed on a machine
Change the binary/executable path of a service
Get information, including the binary (executable) path of a service
Using WMIC to pull a list of every service and the path to its executable
Start a service that was previously stopped
Stop a service that was running
Diplays running processes. Pair with the /v (verbose) switch to get detailed information about each process, including the username

powershell.description: Gets objects that represent the services on a local computer or on a remote computer. Can be piped into fl to display all available properties of each service object in a list format
Gets a list of running processes. Use the PowerShell command below in the example to extract the name, PID, and User
